results.title: Empty Land-New Life
results.brief_description: In 1956 the Ministry for Housing implemented the “Elderly Persons Housing Project” in an attempt to meet the growing demands for public housing by senior citizens. Over the years building costs have increased rapidly and the Ministry feels that if the Community were to donate land for the project this will enable them to continue building suitable accommodation at affordable prices.

results.title: Empty harbours, empty dreams
results.creator_credit: Kent Martin, Barry Cowling, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film explores how the three British colonies of New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Prince Edward Island became provinces of Canada, and it charts the subsequent decline of their economies after Confederation. Photographs, archival drawings, cartoons, and interviews with Maritime historians are used to document the case. An important contribution to the continuing dialogue on the history and evolution of Canada’s federal system.

results.title: Empty arms, broken hearts
results.creator_credit: Iain E. Gillespie, Jacqueline Gillespie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and AFFC
results.brief_description: A film by publicised parents of kidnapped children, Jacqueline and Iain Gillespie, this documentary attempts to enlighten it’s viewer of the torment and distress involved in losing a child to kidnapping by a parent. It also raises the problems associated with bringing into place international treaties designed to allow a country authority to pursue the kidnapping parent and return the child to his/her other parent at home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Iain E. Gillespie, Jacqueline Gillespie, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and AFFC

results.title: Empowering people (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This instructional video uncovers the secrets of how to get people motivated to take more initiative, be more responsible, and reach their potential. Four main steps are recommended. One: empower yourself. This step is directed as managers/supervisors/team leaders; if managers behave like victims, externalising all their problems (i.e. blaming everyone and everything else) then staff will follow suit. Two: Demonstrate empowerment. For managers this means to accept responsibility for problems and go about fixing them your self. Three: give management guarantees that you (i.e. the employee) will implement suggestions. Four: take risks; directed at managers, the recommendation is to listen to and pilot staff ideas, not trounce on them, otherwise managers will be stymieing employees’ creative thinking and potentially losing out on implementing new and successful ideas.

results.title: Empirical formula by micro-analysis
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Shows procedures necessary to determine the empirical formula of a substance. Amounts of carbon, hydrogen and nitrogen are determined by estimating the weight of CO2, H2O and NH3 produced by the unknown. Students are expected to record the data and use it to ascertain the formula. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Empire of the sun [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro
results.brief_description: Jim Graham, a young Briton living a comfortable life in Shanghai, is separated from his parents following the Japanese invasion of China at the start of World War II. The separation leads to Jim being caught in an internment camp where he has to fend for himself. Cast includes John Malkovich, Christian Bale, Miranda Richardson and Nigel Havers. Based on the autobiographical novel by J. G. Ballard.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy, Amblin Entertainment and Robert Shapiro

results.title: Empire of passion = Ai no Borei = Phantom of love
results.creator_credit: Nagisa Oshima, Anatole Dauman, Argos Films and Oshima Productions
results.brief_description: Following the world-wide success of his highly erotic and controversial ‘Ai No Corrida’ (The Realm of the Senses) in 1976, Oshima directed a companion piece, ‘Empire of Passion’, but this time set in late 19th century rural Japan. Toyoji (Tatsuya Fuji), a soldier, returns from the first Chinese War and embarks on a passionate affair with Seki (Kazuko Yoshiyuki), a woman twenty years his senior and married to a hard-drinking rickshaw man. They soon conspire to murder the husband and throw his body down a disused well. Three years later, the husband’s ghost returns to haunt the lovers, thus hastening their downfall. Like much of Oshima’s work the film is based on facts. It also follows Oshima’s defiant stance against Japan’s strict censorship laws and moral codes. However, ‘Ai No Borei’ is less concerned with steamy eroticism than the aftermath of an all consuming passion, namely the devastating effect of guilt. ‘Ai No Borei’ is a straight forward crime of passion story in the vein of ‘The Postman Always Rings Twice’ with the added thrill of an Asian ghost story. Adapted from a novel by Itoko Namura, ‘Ai No Borei’ is also known as ‘Phantom of Love’. Nagisa Oshima was awarded the Best Director Prize at the Cannes Film Festival in 1978. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Empire Games, 1962
results.brief_description: The official film of the 7th Empire Games held at Perth, Western Australia. H.R.H. Prince Philip attended the Games. This is a colorful and fascinating piece of Australian history featuring a very young Dawn Fraser in action.

results.title: Emphysema: the facts
results.creator_credit: Richard Bluestein, Amram Nowak Associates and American Lung Association
results.brief_description: The function of normal lungs is shown and the processes due to cigarette smoking which affect the lung and cause emphysema. Normal lungs are shown and compared with lungs from an emphysema patient. Treatments, which can only alleviate the symptoms, are shown
